SEARCH
Package pegasus.pointer

Interface ObjectPointer<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object to reference
All Superinterfaces:
BasePointer<T>, IndexedIterable<T>, Iterable<T>, Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayPointer
public interface ObjectPointer<T> extends BasePointer<T>, IndexedIterable<T>
A reference-based generic pointer.
See Also:
  • BasePointer
  • ArrayPointer

    • to

      @SafeVarargs static <T> ObjectPointer<T> to(T... values)
      Creates a new pointer referencing the provided array of values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of value to reference
      Parameters:
      values - The values of which to reference
      Returns:
      The constructed pointer
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided array is null

      s - The stream of which to retrieve the values from
      Returns:
      The constructed pointer
      Throws:

    • copyOf

      static <T> ObjectPointer<T> copyOf(ObjectPointer<? extends T> p)
      Creates and returns a shallow copy of the provided pointer p.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of object the pointer references
      Parameters:
      p - The pointer of which to copy
      Returns:
      A shallow copy of the provided pointer p
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided pointer p is null

    • copyOfRange

      static <T> ObjectPointer<T> copyOfRange(ObjectPointer<? extends T> p, int from, int to)
      Creates and returns a shallow copy of the provided pointer p's values within the range of [from, to).
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of object the pointer references
      Parameters:
      p - The pointer of which to copy
      from - The index at which to start the copy at (inclusive)
      to - The index at which to stop the copy at (exclusive)
      Returns:
      A shallow copy of the provided pointer p
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided pointer p is null
      IllegalArgumentException - When the range is invalid
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - When the range is out of bounds

    • firstIndexOf

      int firstIndexOf(T value)
      Returns the index of the first occurrence of the provided value. If no instances are found, this will return -1.
      Parameters:
      value - The value of which to query
      Returns:
      The first index of the provided value

      value - The value of which to query
      Returns:

    • fillRange

      void fillRange(int startIndex, int endIndex, T value) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Fills the specified range of this pointer with the provided value.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - The starting index at which to start filling values (inclusive)
      endIndex - The ending index at which to stop filling values (exclusive)
      value - The value of which to fill the specified range with
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - When the range is invalid, or is out of bounds

    • fillRange

      void fillRange(int startIndex, int endIndex, ObjectPointer<? extends T> p) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Fills the specified range of this pointer with the provided values.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - The starting index at which to start filling values (inclusive)
      endIndex - The ending index at which to stop filling values (exclusive)
      p - The source pointer of which to retrieve values from
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - When the range is invalid, or is out of bounds
      NullPointerException - When the provided pointer is null

    • replace

      void replace(UnaryOperator<T> operator)
      Applies the provided update function to each value of this pointer, then assigns each value to the return value of the provided update function.
      Parameters:
      operator - The update function of which to apply to each value of this pointer
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided update function is null

      newValue - The new value of which to replace to

    • map

      <U> ObjectPointer<U> map(Function<? super T,? extends U> mapper)
      Applies the provided mapper function to each value of this pointer, then returns a new pointer whose values are populated from that of the return values of the provided mapper function.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of object to map this pointer to
      Parameters:
      mapper - The mapper function of which to apply to each value of this pointer
      Returns:
      The resulting pointer
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided mapper function is null

    • cast

      <U> ObjectPointer<U> cast(Class<? extends U> target) throws ClassCastException
      Casts the internal array of this pointer to an array of the provided target class, then returns a pointer to the cast array. The resulting pointer will reference the same array as this pointer.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The class of which to cast to
      Parameters:
      target - The target class of which to cast to
      Returns:
      The cast pointer
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - When the values of this pointer are not an instance of the provided class U
      NullPointerException - When the provided target class is null

    • merge

      <U, V> ObjectPointer<V> merge(ObjectPointer<U> p, BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends V> merger) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException
      Applies the provided merger function to each corresponding pair of values between this pointer and the provided pointer p, then returns a new pointer whose values are populated from that of the return values of the provided merger function.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of object to merge this pointer with
      V - The type of object to merge the pointers to
      Parameters:
      p - The pointer of which to merge this pointer with
      merger - The merger function of which to handle the merging of the two pointers
      Returns:
      The resulting pointer
      Throws:
      IncompatibleDimensionsException - When the pointers' sizes are different
      NullPointerException - When either the provided pointer p or the provided merger function is null

    • resize

      ObjectPointer<T> resize(int size)
      Returns a new pointer with of the provided size whose values are populated from that of this pointer's values, trimmed or padded with null values as necessary.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of which to resize to
      Returns:
      The resized pointer
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the provided size is negative

    • sort

      void sort() throws ClassCastException
      Sorts this pointer's values in their natural ascending order.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - When the pointer's values are not comparable
      NullPointerException - When the pointer contains null values

    • sort

      void sort(Comparator<? super T> sorter)
      Sorts this pointer's values in accordance to the provided sorter function.
      Parameters:
      sorter - The sorter function of which to handle the sorting of the values
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When the provided sorter function is null

    • reverse

      void reverse()
      Reverses the order of this pointer. For instance, the pointer ["hello", "world"] will become ["world", "hello"].

    • shuffle

      void shuffle()
      Shuffles this pointer's values in a randomized manner.
